com.orbitz.monitoring.api
Class MonitoringEngine

java.lang.Object
  com.orbitz.monitoring.api.MonitoringEngine

public class MonitoringEngine
extends java.lang.Object

The engine that controls basic correlation of monitors as they are collected and submitted to the engine. All monitors should call these methods at key points in their lifetime so that they are processed correctly.

Constructor Detail

MonitoringEngine

protected MonitoringEngine()
Method Detail

getInstance

public static MonitoringEngine getInstance()

startup

public void startup()
Starts up the monitoring engine. This method should be called before using ERMA.

This call initializes the system and calls startup() on the MonitorProcessorFactory supplied. Therefore, the MonitorProcessorFactory to be used should have been set prior to calling this method.

This method is not thread-safe. Client should take care to ensure that multithreaded access to this method is synchronized.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down the monitoring engine. This method should be called before shutting down the application to give the ERMA system a chance to cleanly close all its resources.

This call disables ERMA and calls shutdown() on the MonitorProcessorFactory supplied.

This method is not thread-safe. Client should take care to ensure that multithreaded access to this method is synchronized.

restart

public void restart()
Shuts down the MonitoringEngine if it is running. After it is shutdown, the MonitoringEngine will be started up.

This method is not thread-safe. Client should take care to ensure that multithreaded access to this method is synchronized.

clearCurrentThread

public int clearCurrentThread()
Clears away any outstanding CompositeMonitor references held by the MonitoringEngine for the current thread. This is useful to do in a long-running application at some point before you create what should be the first/outermost CompositeMonitor for a given thread. It reduces risk of heap leaks caused by accumulating unfinished CompositeMonitor instances. IMPORTANT NOTE: This method does not "close" any monitors that are found and cleared in this fashion. Only the references to them are removed from an internal stack that's mapped from the current thread. Since it does not close them, no MonitorProcessors will be notified of this event.

Returns:
count of monitor refs cleared

initMonitor

public void initMonitor(Monitor monitor)
A lifecycle method that initializes the Monitor. All monitor implementations must call this methods before setting any attributes on themselves.

After this method returns, the monitor will have had any implicitly inherited and global attributes applied.

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor to initialize.

initMonitor

public void initMonitor(Monitor monitor,
                        boolean includeInheritables)

monitorCreated

public void monitorCreated(Monitor monitor)
A lifecycle method that notifies observing MonitorProcessors that a new monitor has been created. All monitor implementations should call this method after setting attributes known at creation on themselves.

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor that has been created

monitorStarted

public void monitorStarted(Monitor monitor)
A lifecylce method that notifies observing MonitorProcessors that a monitor has been started. All monitor implementations that have a start-stop concept should call this monitor at start.

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor that has started

process

public void process(Monitor monitor)
A lifecycle method that notifies observing MonitorProcessors that a monitor is ready to be processed. All monitor implementations should call as the last call of their lifecycle.

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor that should be processed

compositeMonitorStarted

public void compositeMonitorStarted(CompositeMonitor compositeMonitor)
Adds the supplied CompositeMonitor to the stack for this thread. If this is the first CompositeMonitor on this thread, a new LinkedList is created and added to a map holding all stacks by Thread.

This method should be called by all CompositeMonitor implementations before they call monitorStarted().

Parameters:
compositeMonitor - the monitor to add to the stack

compositeMonitorCompleted

public void compositeMonitorCompleted(CompositeMonitor monitor)
Pops this monitor off the top of the stack. If this monitor is not on the top of the stack nor found anywhere within the stack, the monitor is ignored, as this is an error in instrumentation. If the monitor is found within the stack, the top of the stack is repeatedly popped and processed until this monitor is on the the top.

This method should be called by all CompositeMonitor implementations before they call process().

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor that is completed

getCompositeMonitorNamed

public CompositeMonitor getCompositeMonitorNamed(java.lang.String name)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Obtains the first CompositeMonitor found on the per thread stack that has its name attribute equal to the supplied name. This method should be used in situations where stateless code is unable to hold a reference to the CompositeMonitor that was originally created. Supplying the name value is needed to ensure that instrumentation errors in code called by users of this method does not interfere with the ability to correctly obtain the original CompositeMonitor.

Parameters:
name - the value of name that our Monitor was created with.
Returns:
the first CompositeMonitor with the supplied name, or null if not found
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null

getInheritableAttributes

public java.util.Map getInheritableAttributes()
Returns the current inheritable attributes for this thread.

Returns:
the inheritable attributes that would be applied to a monitor if it were made right now, or an empty Map if there are none

makeAttributeHoldersSerializable

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.io.Serializable> makeAttributeHoldersSerializable(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends AttributeHolder> attributeHolders)
Takes the supplied attributes and returns an equivalent set that are ready to be serialized. Will only return those attributes that are marked as serializable.

Parameters:
attributeHolders - the attributes to prepare for serialization
Returns:
an equivalent set of attributes that can be serialized

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Gets enabled state of MonitoringEngine. No monitors are processed until this returns true.

Returns:
true if monitoringEnabled (default) and when running (between startup() and shutdown() in lifecycle)

getProcessorLevel

public MonitoringLevel getProcessorLevel(java.lang.String name)
Given the name of a MonitorProcessor, return the MonitoringLevel that should be used for that MonitorProcessor. If no level has been specified then return null.

Parameters:
name - the name of the MonitorProcessor to retrieve the level for.
Returns:
a MonitoringLevel appropriate for the MonitorProcessor, or null if one does not apply.

getOverrideLevelForMonitor

public MonitoringLevel getOverrideLevelForMonitor(Monitor monitor)
Given a monitor, look at its name and see if there has been an updated level set during runtime. The updated level can apply for a specific monitor "com.orbitz.foo.bar" or any package "com.orbitz.foo"

Parameters:
monitor - the monitor to check for an updated level
Returns:
the appropiate level for this monitor, if a new level has been set at runtime that will be returned, if not the monitor's level set at construction time will be returned.
